items.name: Pelegrim
items.tastingNotes: Apples, raspberries and sourdough, lemon and biscuit.
items.about: Traditional method sparkling from chalky soils, lees-aged 36 months. Named after 'Pilgrim' near Pilgrim's Way.

items.name: Blanc de Blancs
items.tastingNotes: Ripe citrus and stone fruit on the nose, with a rich biscuity note. Palate is dominate by ripe fruit, yellow apple, white peach, honey and citrus notes.
items.about: Whole bunch pressed Chardonnay, fermented mostly in steel with some old oak. Lees aged 42 months, bottle aged 6 months.

items.name: Fluence Brut Nature
items.tastingNotes: Soft and elegant mousse, fresh citrus and stone fruits, creamy biscuit notes.
items.about: Natural approach from Vallee de la Marne. Indigenous yeasts, no fining/filtering, avoids barrels. Brut Nature.

items.name: 'Nos Pas Dans La Craie' Blanc de Blancs
items.tastingNotes: Aromas of citrus fruit, white fruit, fantastic acidity paired with a persistent mineral finish.
items.about: Brut Nature from 40+ year old vines in Montgenost (lieu-dit Le Grande Montagne). Chalky soils.

items.name: Grand Cuvee 172ème
items.tastingNotes: Blooming flowers, ripe, dried and citrus fruits, a touch of gingerbread. Hazelnut, almond brioche and honey with a lively acidity.
items.about: Blend of 146 wines from 11 years. Fermented in small oak barrels, lees aged 6 years. 44% Pinot Noir, 36% Chardonnay, 20% Meunier.

items.name: Dom Perignon 2013
items.tastingNotes: Green fruit, plum, apricot and oranges. Blossom and pepper with a silky-smooth saline finish in and amongst toasty hues.
items.about: Single vintage blend from top 17 crus. Aged 8 years in cellar before release.

items.name: Rose
items.tastingNotes: Delicate mousse with a pomegranate pink colour. Tropical fruits such as lychee and guava, rose pomegranate, raspberries, cherries, pink grapefruit, elegant.
items.about: Blend of ~80% Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. Claimed first rose Champagne. Oldest Champagne house (1729).

items.name: Grüner Veltliner
items.tastingNotes: Green fruit, white pepper spice, honeydew, a touch of saltiness and great balance of yeastiness and fruit.
items.about: Whole bunch pressed, natural ferment in stainless steel, long lees ageing. Unfined, unfiltered.

items.name: La Pepie Chignin
items.tastingNotes: Freshness, mineral and alpine. Floral and fragrant notes, tangy, fresh and tense palate, light and aromatic.
items.about: Hand-harvested from steep (50%) limestone slopes worked by horse. Whole cluster pressed, fermented in tank, 4 months ageing.

items.name: Severna Morava
items.tastingNotes: Peach, ripe yellow apple and citrus fruits. Tropical, pinappale, mango, nectarines. Juicy with intervening lemongrass and melon characteristics.
items.about: From Fruska Gora national park slopes. Morava is a Serbian crossing (Traminer x Riesling). Modern techniques used.

items.name: 'Rheingau' Riesling
items.tastingNotes: Peach, nectarine, pear and lime. Slight spritz on the palate. Fresh and bright acidity to finish.
items.about: Dry Riesling from various Rheingau sites. Spontaneous fermentation in stainless steel.

items.name: Trinquàmes
items.tastingNotes: Fresh and aromatic, citrus and tropical fruit with a mineral backbone.
items.about: From 25-year-old vines on clay/limestone. Hand harvested, fermented and aged in stainless steel.

items.name: 'Calvarino' Soave
items.tastingNotes: Straw yellow, greenish hints, white flower, almond blossom, ripe fruit with a fresh clean acidity. Fragrant and long, almond pastry to finish.
items.about: Single vineyard (Calvarino) Soave Classico from volcanic hills. Fermented and aged 1 year in glass-lined cement tanks on fine lees.

items.name: 'Au Quin Château' Macon-Cruzille
items.tastingNotes: Notes of fresh lemon and almond, textured palate with elements of lemon pith and apple.
items.about: From 30-year-old vines on white/blue marl. Pressed into barrels, aged 8 months. Unfined, unfiltered. Oldest continually organic winery in France.

items.name: Central Coast Chardonnay
items.tastingNotes: Golden apple fruits, dried flower, nutty/almond notes, touch of spice, still a lovely freshness in acidity.
items.about: Collaboration focusing on Santa Barbara fruit. Wild fermentations, minimal additions, conservative new oak. Inspired by Burgundy.

items.name: 'Leirana' Albariño
items.tastingNotes: Orchard fruit, pears, mineral, saline and bright. Lightness with a youthful zest.
items.about: From 90-150 year old vines. Fermented/aged mostly in steel (80%) with some neutral oak (20%) on lees.

items.name: 'Benje'
items.tastingNotes: Citrus and a slight herbaceous note, delicately floral with a creamy profile from the flor ageing that adds complexity and a smoothness to the wine. Saline and refreshing.
items.about: High altitude (1000m) vines. Fermented in concrete (25% skin contact). Aged in concrete & neutral oak foudre, 40% under flor.

items.name: Chassagne-Montrachet 'Les Chenevottes'
items.tastingNotes: Green apple, peaches, buttery aspect.
items.about: Premier Cru vineyard near Le Montrachet. Old school winemaking, fermented and aged 12+ months in oak.

items.name: 'Bohem' Friulano
items.tastingNotes: Sweet spice and white peach aromatics with a mineral finish.
items.about: 3 days skin contact, 12 months aging in old oak. Unfiltered, spontaneous fermentation.

items.name: L' Écorce Buissonnière
items.tastingNotes: Fresh, bright, fresh rose, grapefruit and some red berries.
items.about: From 40-50 year old vines on clay/limestone. Direct press, indigenous yeast ferment in concrete/amphora, aged on lees.

items.name: Cru Classé
items.variety: Grenache, Tibouren, Syrah, Vermentino, Cinsault, Semillon
items.tastingNotes: Summer fruit, yellow peach and floral notes. Pomelo and pineapple, silky structure with a delicately dry finish.
items.about: Cru Classé lieu-dit. Complex style, 30% vinified/aged 4-5 months in French oak demi-muids (62% new).

items.name: Nomad Collab
items.tastingNotes: Floral, violet, red cherry, red berries, integrated acidity with rustic qualities, moderate tannins.
items.about: Destemmed, spontaneous ferment in concrete/wood/amphora (<24hr skin contact), aged 5 months. Served in can.

items.name: Pinot Noir
items.tastingNotes: Red cherry, raspberry, cranberry, earthy notes, forest floor, mushroom, silky tannins.
items.about: Burgundian family estate in Oregon. Destemmed, fermented in wood/steel, aged 14 months in French oak (20% new).

items.name: Bourgogne Rouge
items.tastingNotes: Bright red fruit, cherry, raspberry, earthy undertones, subtle spice.
items.about: From old vines (50-70 years) near Beaune. Minimal intervention, aged in used oak.

items.name: Fleurie 'Grand Pré'
items.tastingNotes: Floral (violet, iris), red berries, cherry, light-bodied, smooth tannins.
items.about: From 60-year-old vines on pink granite. Carbonic maceration, aged in concrete.

items.name: Chianti Classico
items.tastingNotes: Sour cherry, plum, leather, tobacco, earthy notes, firm tannins.
items.about: Traditional style from Castelnuovo Berardenga. Aged 12 months in large Slavonian oak casks.

items.name: Rioja Reserva
items.tastingNotes: Dried red fruit, leather, vanilla, coconut, spice, savoury, complex.
items.about: Iconic traditional Rioja. Aged 6 years in American oak barrels, racked twice yearly.

items.name: Saint-Joseph 'Offerus'
items.tastingNotes: Blackberry, black olive, pepper, smoked meat, violets, firm structure.
items.about: Négociant label from Jean-Louis Chave. Sourced from top sites, aged in neutral oak.

items.name: Cabernet Sauvignon
items.variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc
items.tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, cassis, cedar, tobacco leaf, graphite, structured tannins.
items.about: Iconic California producer. Estate fruit from Monte Bello vineyard. Aged 17 months in American oak (mostly new).

items.name: Barolo 'Castiglione'
items.tastingNotes: Rose petals, tar, cherry, licorice, powerful tannins, long finish.
items.about: Blend from several crus in Castiglione Falletto. Aged ~30 months in large Slavonian oak casks.
